verbs.description: hamshackle (third-person singular simple present hamshackles, present participle hamshackling, simple past and past participle hamshackled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To tie (an animal) by a rope binding the head to one of the forelegs.
examples: to hamshackle a horse or cow

entries.meaning: (transitive, figurative) To bind or restrain; to impose restrictions upon.
